sentences.sContent: The Nobel Prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences.
sentences.sCn: 诺贝尔奖已成为科学界的最高荣誉。

sentences.sContent: He won accolades as one of America's top test pilots.
sentences.sCn: 他作为美国顶级试飞员之一赢得了众多荣誉。

synos.tran: 荣誉；荣誉称号授予仪式；连谱号；称赞

remMethod.val: ac (加强) + col (脖子) + ade (动作) → 伸长脖子， 啧啧称赞 → 赞美

trans.tranCn: 荣誉；荣誉称号授予仪式；连谱号；称赞
trans.tranOther: If someone is given an accolade, something is done or said about them which shows how much people admire them
